intro: Schoenoplectiella bucharica, commonly known as the Bukhara sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often inconspicuous. Its botanical structure is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
